Processing Project Quotes: Process Activity The following activity will walk you through the process of creating a project quote and creating a project based on the project quote. You will also learn how project quotes are integrated with opportunities. The following activity is based on the U100 dataset. If you are using another dataset, or if any system settings have been changed in U100 , these changes can affect the workflow of the activity and the results of the processing. To avoid any issues, restore the U100 dataset to its initial state. Story Suppose that the HM's Bakery and Cafe customer has ordered a juicer for one of its restaurants, along with the installation and training services. The sales manager has created an opportunity for the provision of the juicer and the services. Acting as an estimator, you will create a project quote for this opportunity, confirm the quote with the customer, and convert the quote to the project. Configuration Overview For the purposes of this activity, the following features have been enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form: Project Accounting , which provides support for the project accounting functionality Project Quotes , which provides the ability to create project quotes Customer Management , which provides the customer relation management (CRM) functionality, including management of opportunities On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR304000|CR304000]) Opportunities (CR304000) form, the 000001 opportunity has been created. A note and a file have been attached to the opportunity. On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM208000|PM208000]) Project Templates (PM208000) form, the PROGRESS project template has been configured. On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM208010|PM208010]) Project Template Tasks (PM208010) form, the PHASE1 and PHASE2 project template tasks have been created for the PROGRESS project template. On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM201000|PM201000]) Account Groups (PM201000) form, the REVENUE , MATERIAL , SUBCON , and LABOR account groups have been created. On the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202500|IN202500]) Stock Items (IN202500) form, the JUICER15 stock item has been configured. On the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form, the INSTALL and TRAINING non-stock items have been configured. Process Overview In this activity, on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR304000|CR304000]) Opportunities (CR304000) form, you will initiate the creation of a project quote for the opportunity created for the customer. On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) Project Quotes (PM304500) form, you will then configure the project quote, including the creation of estimation lines. You will also print the project quote and email it to the customer for review. Then you will convert the quote to a project. System Preparation Before you begin performing the steps of this activity, perform the following instructions to prepare the system: Launch the Acumatica ERP website, and sign in to a company with the U100 dataset preloaded as Pam Brawner by using the brawner username and the 123 password. In the info area, in the upper-right corner of the top pane of the Acumatica ERP screen, make sure that the business date in your system is set to 1/30/2020. If a different date is displayed, click the Business Date menu button, and select 1/30/2020 on the calendar. For simplicity, in this activity, you will create and process all documents in the system during this business date. Step 1: Creating a Project Quote To create a project quote for an opportunity, do the following: On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR304000|CR304000]) Opportunities (CR304000) form, open the 000001 opportunity, and in the Summary area, notice that the amount in the Amount box is equal to 3,500.00 . On the form toolbar, click Create Quote . In the Create New Quote dialog box, which opens, do the following: Select Project Quote as the Quote Type . Notice that the Make New Quote Primary check box is selected. Click Create and Review . The system creates a project quote based on the opportunity and opens the project quote on the ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) Project Quotes (PM304500) form. On this form, review the created project quote, and notice the following: In the Summary area, the Primary check box is selected, which means that the project is the primary quote of the opportunity, whose identifier is shown in the Opportunity ID box. On the form title bar, the icon left of Notes is shaded in yellow, and (1) is shown after Files , indicating that the project quote has a note and an attached file, which have been copied from the opportunity. In the Summary area, specify the following settings: Project Template : PROGRESS New Project ID : HMBAKERY1 When you select the project template, the system fills in the relevant elements of the project quote with the settings specified for the template. On the Project Tasks tab, review the tasks that have been copied from the selected project template. Notice that the Default check box is selected for the PHASE1 task. The project task is specified as the default task of the project quote because this task is the default task of the selected project template. On the Estimation tab, add three lines with the settings from the following table (clearing the default settings in the specified columns); these settings establish cost by task and inventory item. Inventory ID Quantity Ext. Price Project Task Cost Account Group Revenue Account Group JUICER15 1.00 Cleared PHASE1 MATERIAL Cleared INSTALL 4.00 Cleared PHASE1 SUBCON Cleared TRAINING 8.00 Cleared PHASE2 LABOR Cleared Notice that the system automatically selects PHASE1 as the project task in a new estimation line because this task is selected as the default for the project quote. You have cleared the Ext. Price and Revenue Account Group columns so that when this quote is converted to a project, the system will not convert these lines, which have no price and no revenue account group, to revenue budget lines of the project. Add two more estimation lines with the settings from the following table; these settings establish revenue by task. Description Ext. Price Project Task Revenue Account Group The juicer with installation 2900.00 PHASE1 REVENUE Training of employees 400.00 PHASE2 REVENUE Notice that for each of the added lines the Ext. Cost and Cost Account Group columns are empty. When this quote is converted to a project, the system will not convert these lines, which have no cost and cost account group, to cost budget lines of the project. Save your changes to the project quote. In the Summary area, notice that the amount in the Total Sales box is 3,300.00 , which is the total of the values in the Ext. Price column on the Estimation tab. On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR304000|CR304000]) Opportunities form, again open the 000001 opportunity, and notice the following: In the Summary area, the Amount of the opportunity has been changed to the total sales of the created project quote ( 3,300.00 ). On the Quotes tab, where the project quote you created is listed in the table, the total sales of the quote is shown in the Amount column ( 3,300.00 ). Also, the check box in the Primary column is selected, which means that this is the primary project quote of the opportunity. Step 2: Sending the Project Quote for Confirmation To email and print the project quote, do the following: On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) Project Quotes (PM304500) form, open the project quote that you have just created. On the form toolbar, click Submit Quote . The system changes the status of the quote to Prepared . Notice that now you cannot edit the project quote. On the form toolbar, click Actions Send Quote to send the project quote to the customer. The system generates the ([~/?ScreenId=PM604500|PM604500]) Project Quote (PM604500) report, which is a ready-to-print version of the quote. It then attaches the quote to the email, and sends the email to the customer's email address, which is specified on the Billing Information tab of this form. The system also changes the status of the project quote to Sent . Open the Activities tab, and notice that an activity related to the sent email is listed in the table. The Summary column contains the link to the email. If you clicked the link, the system would open the email on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR306015|CR306015]) Email Activity (CR306015) form. On the form toolbar, click Actions Print Quote to print the project quote. The system navigates to the ([~/?ScreenId=PM604500|PM604500]) Project Quote report, which is a ready-to-print version of the quote. Step 3: Creating a Project Based on the Project Quote To create a project based on the project quote, do the following: On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) Project Quotes (PM304500) form, open the project quote that you have created, and in the Summary area, notice that the amount in the Total Sales and Total Cost boxes are equal to 3,300.00 and 2,640.00 , respectively. On the form toolbar, click Convert to Project to convert the quote to a project. In the Convert to Project dialog box, which opens, select the following check boxes: Copy Notes to Project Copy Files to Project The Link Activities to Project check box in the dialog box is cleared by default. If you were to select this check box, the system would automatically select PHASE1 as the project task to which the activities copied from the project quote would be linked in the created project. This is because PHASE1 is the default task of the PROGRESS project template. Click OK . The system closes the dialog box, changes the status of the project quote to Closed , creates a project based on the project quote, and opens the project on the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form. On the form title bar, notice that the icon left of Notes is shaded in yellow, and (1) is shown after Files , indicating that the project has a note and an attached file, which have been copied from the project quote (and were previously copied from the opportunity). On the Summary tab, in the Quote section, make sure that the number of the corresponding project quote is shown in the Quote Ref. Nbr. box. On the Tasks tab, review the project tasks that have been copied from the project quote. Notice that the check box in the Default column is selected for the PHASE1 task, indicating that it is the default task of the created project. On the Revenue Budget tab, review the revenue budget lines of the project, and notice that they have been created based on the estimation lines of the project quote with the specified revenue account group. On the Cost Budget tab, review the cost budget lines of the project, and notice that they have been created based on the estimation lines of the project quote with the specified cost account group. On the Balances tab (see the following screenshot), verify the totals: The Income Totals of the project balance should match the Total Sales of the project quote, and the Expense Totals of the project balance should match the Total Cost of the project quote. The balances of the project created based on the project quote On the ([~/?ScreenId=CR304000|CR304000]) Opportunities (CR304000) form, open the 000001 opportunity, and review the opportunity as follows: On the Activities tab, notice that the email created for the project quote is also listed in the table for the opportunity. On the Quotes tab, in the Project ID column, find the identifier of the project created based on the project quote.

Processing Project Quotes: Related Report and Inquiry Forms In the following sections, you can find details about the reports and inquiry forms you may want to review to gather information about project quotes. If you do not see a particular report or form that is described, you may have signed in to the system with a user account that does not have access rights to the report or form. Contact your system administrator to obtain access to any needed reports or forms. Printing of a Project Quote You can print a project quote with any status. On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) Project Quotes (PM304500) form, you can print the selected project quote by clicking Actions Print Quote on the form toolbar. If a project quote has been created based on an opportunity, you can also print a project quote on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR304000|CR304000]) Opportunities (CR304000) form. To do this, on the Quotes tab, you select the project quote, and on the table toolbar, you click Print Quote . For the printing of project quotes, the system uses the ([~/?ScreenId=PM604500|PM604500]) Project Quote (PM604500) report. This report includes estimation lines, the header-level note, and the detailed description of a project quote. On the Billing Information tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) Project Quotes form, you can specify the contact information of the customer to whom the project quote should be sent.

When the system creates a project based on a project quote, the settings of the created project on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_10_00|Projects] ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) form are populated as follows: [anchor|#ul_nzk_gss_nlb] *The '''Customer''' and '''Description''' in the Summary area: With the corresponding settings of the project quote from the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_45_00|Project Quotes] ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) form *The general information on the '''Summary''' tab: With the corresponding settings of the project template on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_20_80_00|Project Templates] ([~/?ScreenId=PM208000|PM208000]) form {br}
The following sections describe the rules that the system uses during creation of a project based on the project quote, as well as some specific settings that the system inserts.{br}{TOC} ==Summary Information== When the system creates a project based on the project quote, in the Summary area of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_10_00|Projects] ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) form, some settings of the created project are populated as follows:[anchor|#ul_n35_h4k_y2b] *'''Project ID''': If auto-numbering has been configured for projects, the project identifier is assigned automatically. If auto-numbering has not been configured, the system fills this box with the '''New Project ID''' value that was specified for the project quote on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_45_00|Project Quotes] ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) form. *'''Template''': This box is left empty. The reference number of the project template is not copied from the project quote to the project. This helps users to avoid confusion, because a project that is created based on a project quote with a project template specified can have a different structure of project tasks and the project budget than a project that is created directly on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_10_00|Projects] form and based on the same project template. *'''Status''': The status of the new project is ''Active'' if the '''Activate Project''' check box was selected in the '''Convert to Project''' dialog box that was used when the project task was converted to a project. If the check box was cleared, the status is ''In Planning''.
==Project Tasks== When the system creates a project based on the project quote, it populates the tasks on the '''Tasks''' tab of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_10_00|Projects] ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) form using the following rules:[anchor|#ul_xgw_1vk_y2b] *If the project quote has two or more tasks, these tasks are copied to the project. In this case, if the project quote does not have a default task, and the created project does not have the default task either. *If the project quote has only one task, this task is copied to the project. It is also marked as the default task of the project even if the task has not been marked as the default task of the project quote. *If the project quote has no tasks, the system creates a default project task for the project—that is, a task with an identifier of ''0'' and a description of ''Default''. *The status of the created project tasks is ''Active'' if the '''Activate Tasks''' check box was selected in the '''Convert to Project''' dialog box during the conversion process. If the check box was cleared, the status is ''In Planning''. *The location of the created tasks is the location of the project quote from the '''Billing Information''' tab of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_45_00|Project Quotes] ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) form. *If the project quote has only one task or does not have any tasks and if some or all the estimation lines of the project quote have no project task assigned, the system assigns the default task of the project to the cost budget and revenue budget lines of the project that it creates based on these estimation lines.
==The Revenue Budget== When the system creates a project based on the project quote, to populate the revenue budget, the system groups the estimation lines of the project quote depending on the revenue budget level (''Task'', ''Task and Item'', or ''Task and Cost Code'') of the project template specified for the project quote, as specified on the '''Summary''' tab ('''Project Properties''' section) of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_20_80_00|Project Templates] ([~/?ScreenId=PM208000|PM208000]) form. For each group of estimation lines, on the '''Revenue Budget''' tab of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_10_00|Projects] ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) form, the system creates a revenue budget line with the following settings:[anchor|#ul_ckd_5qv_q2b] *'''Project Task''': The system uses the project task of the aggregated estimation lines. *'''Inventory ID''': The system uses the inventory ID of the aggregated estimation lines. Estimation lines without an inventory item specified are aggregated into a cost budget line with this column populated with the empty item code, which is defined in the '''Empty Item Code''' box on the '''General Settings''' tab of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_10_10_00|Projects Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=PM101000|PM101000]) form. *'''Account Group''': The system uses the revenue account group of the aggregated estimation lines. *'''Description''': Depending on the number of aggregated estimation lines in a group, the system assigns the following description to the revenue budget line: **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of one line, the description of this line is copied to the cost budget line. **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines, the description of the cost budget line is {{Aggregated: [Account Group Description]}}, where {{Account Group Description}} is the description of the account group by which the group of estimation lines has been aggregated. *'''Original Budgeted Quantity''': The system inserts the total quantity of the aggregated lines if each of the lines has the same UOM. Otherwise, the quantity is zero. *'''UOM''': The system uses the UOM of the aggregated estimation lines if each of the lines has the same UOM. Otherwise, the UOM is empty. *'''Unit Rate''': The calculation of the unit rate of the revenue budget line depends on the number of aggregated estimation lines in a group as follows: **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of one line, the unit price of this line is copied to the revenue budget line. **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines and each of these lines has the same UOM, the system calculates the unit rate as the total '''Amount''' of the lines divided by the total quantity of the lines. **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines and the lines have different UOM values, the unit rate of the revenue budget line is zero. *'''Original Budgeted Amount''': The system inserts the total amount of the aggregated lines. *'''Tax Category''': The tax category of the revenue budget line depends on the tax category of aggregated estimation lines in the group as follows: **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of one line, the tax category of this line is copied to the revenue budget line. **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines and all the lines have the same tax category, this tax category is copied to the revenue budget line. **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines and the lines have either the same tax category or an empty tax category, the specified tax category is copied to the revenue budget line. **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines and the lines have at least two different tax categories, the tax category of the revenue budget line is empty.
==The Cost Budget== When the system creates a project based on the project quote, to populate the cost budget, the system groups the estimation lines of the project quote depending on the cost budget level (''Task'', ''Task and Item'', or ''Task and Cost Code'') of the project template specified for the project quote, as specified on the '''Summary''' tab ('''Project Properties''' section) of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_20_80_00|Project Templates] ([~/?ScreenId=PM208000|PM208000]) form. For each group of estimation lines, on the '''Cost Budget''' tab of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_10_00|Projects] ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) form, the system creates a cost budget line with the following settings:[anchor|#ul_cxz_hqv_q2b] *'''Project Task''': The system inserts the project task of the aggregated estimation lines. *'''Inventory ID''': The system uses the inventory ID of the aggregated estimation lines. Estimation lines without an inventory item specified are aggregated into a cost budget line with this column populated with the empty item code, which is defined in the '''Empty Item Code''' box on the '''General Settings''' tab of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_10_10_00|Projects Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=PM101000|PM101000]) form. *'''Account Group''': The system inserts the cost account group of the aggregated estimation lines. *'''Description''': Depending on the number of aggregated estimation lines in a group, the system assigns the following description to the cost budget line: **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of one line, the description of this line is copied to the cost budget line. **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines, the description of the cost budget line is {{Aggregated: [Account Group Description]}}, where {{Account Group Description}} is the description of the account group by which the group of estimation lines has been aggregated. *'''Original Budgeted Quantity''': The system inserts the total quantity of the aggregated lines if each of the lines has the same UOM. Otherwise, the quantity is zero. *'''UOM''': The system uses the UOM of the aggregated estimation lines if each of the lines has the same UOM. Otherwise, the UOM is empty. *'''Unit Rate''': The calculation of the unit rate of the cost budget line depends on the number of aggregated estimation lines in the group as follows: **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of one line, the unit rate of this line is copied to the cost budget line. **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines, the system calculates the unit rate as the sum of the '''Ext. Cost''' values of lines that have a nonzero quantity, divided by the total quantity of these lines. The lines of the group with a quantity or '''Ext. Cost''' of zero are ignored in the calculation. *'''Original Budgeted Amount''': The system calculates this amount as the total extended cost of the aggregated lines. *'''Unit Price''': The calculation of the unit price of the cost budget line depends on the number of aggregated estimation lines in the group as follows: **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of one line, the unit price of this line is copied to the cost budget line. **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines and each of these lines has the same UOM, the system calculates the unit price as the sum of the '''Amount''' values of the lines divided by the total quantity of the lines. **If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines and the lines have different UOM values, the unit price of the cost budget line is zero.

Processing Project Quotes: Project Creation Rules When the system creates a project based on a project quote, the settings of the created project on the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form are populated as follows: The Customer and Description in the Summary area: With the corresponding settings of the project quote from the ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) Project Quotes (PM304500) form The general information on the Summary tab: With the corresponding settings of the project template on the ([~/?ScreenId=PM208000|PM208000]) Project Templates (PM208000) form The following sections describe the rules that the system uses during creation of a project based on the project quote, as well as some specific settings that the system inserts. Summary Information When the system creates a project based on the project quote, in the Summary area of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form, some settings of the created project are populated as follows: Project ID : If auto-numbering has been configured for projects, the project identifier is assigned automatically. If auto-numbering has not been configured, the system fills this box with the New Project ID value that was specified for the project quote on the ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) Project Quotes (PM304500) form. Template : This box is left empty. The reference number of the project template is not copied from the project quote to the project. This helps users to avoid confusion, because a project that is created based on a project quote with a project template specified can have a different structure of project tasks and the project budget than a project that is created directly on the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects form and based on the same project template. Status : The status of the new project is Active if the Activate Project check box was selected in the Convert to Project dialog box that was used when the project task was converted to a project. If the check box was cleared, the status is In Planning . Project Tasks When the system creates a project based on the project quote, it populates the tasks on the Tasks tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form using the following rules: If the project quote has two or more tasks, these tasks are copied to the project. In this case, if the project quote does not have a default task, and the created project does not have the default task either. If the project quote has only one task, this task is copied to the project. It is also marked as the default task of the project even if the task has not been marked as the default task of the project quote. If the project quote has no tasks, the system creates a default project task for the project—that is, a task with an identifier of 0 and a description of Default . The status of the created project tasks is Active if the Activate Tasks check box was selected in the Convert to Project dialog box during the conversion process. If the check box was cleared, the status is In Planning . The location of the created tasks is the location of the project quote from the Billing Information tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM304500|PM304500]) Project Quotes (PM304500) form. If the project quote has only one task or does not have any tasks and if some or all the estimation lines of the project quote have no project task assigned, the system assigns the default task of the project to the cost budget and revenue budget lines of the project that it creates based on these estimation lines. For each group of estimation lines, on the Revenue Budget tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form, the system creates a revenue budget line with the following settings: Project Task : The system uses the project task of the aggregated estimation lines. Inventory ID : The system uses the inventory ID of the aggregated estimation lines. Estimation lines without an inventory item specified are aggregated into a cost budget line with this column populated with the empty item code, which is defined in the Empty Item Code box on the General Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM101000|PM101000]) Projects Preferences (PM101000) form. Account Group : The system uses the revenue account group of the aggregated estimation lines. Description : Depending on the number of aggregated estimation lines in a group, the system assigns the following description to the revenue budget line: If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of one line, the description of this line is copied to the cost budget line. If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines, the description of the cost budget line is Aggregated: [Account Group Description] , where Account Group Description is the description of the account group by which the group of estimation lines has been aggregated. Original Budgeted Quantity : The system inserts the total quantity of the aggregated lines if each of the lines has the same UOM. Otherwise, the quantity is zero. UOM : The system uses the UOM of the aggregated estimation lines if each of the lines has the same UOM. Otherwise, the UOM is empty. Unit Rate : The calculation of the unit rate of the revenue budget line depends on the number of aggregated estimation lines in a group as follows: If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of one line, the unit price of this line is copied to the revenue budget line. If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines and each of these lines has the same UOM, the system calculates the unit rate as the total Amount of the lines divided by the total quantity of the lines. If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines and the lines have different UOM values, the unit rate of the revenue budget line is zero. Original Budgeted Amount : The system inserts the total amount of the aggregated lines. Tax Category : The tax category of the revenue budget line depends on the tax category of aggregated estimation lines in the group as follows: If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of one line, the tax category of this line is copied to the revenue budget line. If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines and all the lines have the same tax category, this tax category is copied to the revenue budget line. If the group of aggregated estimation lines consists of two or more lines and the lines have either the same tax category or an empty tax category, the specified tax category is copied to the revenue budget line. Cost values of lines that have a nonzero quantity, divided by the total quantity of these lines. The lines of the group with a quantity or Ext. Cost of zero are ignored in the calculation. row.column: This chapter describes how to purchase materials and services for projects by processing purchase orders and accounts payable bills. ==In This Chapter== *[HelpRoot_Projects\Projects_Project_Purchases_GeneralInfo|Processing Purchases on Projects: General Information] *:In Acumatica ERP, you can purchase materials and services on projects using purchase orders and accounts payable bills so that these purchases affect the cost budget of the projects. *[HelpRoot_Projects\Projects_Project_Purchases_Implem_Checklist|Processing Purchases on Projects: Implementation Checklist] *:The following sections provide details you can use to ensure that the system is configured properly for processing purchases on projects, and to understand (and change, if needed) the settings that affect the processing workflow. *[HelpRoot_Projects\Projects_Project_Purchases_Process_Activity_PO|Processing Purchases on Projects: To Purchase Materials and Services for a Project] *:The following activity will walk you through the process of purchasing materials and services for a project from a subcontractor with purchase orders. *[HelpRoot_Projects\Projects_Project_Purchases_Process_Activity_AP_Bill|Processing Purchases on Projects: To Purchase Services for a Project] *:The following activity will walk you through the process of purchasing services for a project from a subcontractor with accounts payable bills. *[HelpRoot_Projects\Projects_Project_Purchases_Transactions|Processing Purchases on Projects: Generated Transactions] *:When you process a purchase order for a project, you create purchase receipts and accounts payable bills. You can also create a standalone AP bill for a project. On release of the inventory receipt associated with the purchase receipt or the AP bill, the system generates the GL and project transactions described in the following sections. *[HelpRoot_Projects\Projects_Project_Purchases_MassProcessing|Processing Purchases on Projects: Mass-Processing of Documents] *:The following sections explain how to mass-process purchase orders and related documents, and how the system generates, changes, or works with documents as a result of the mass processing. *[HelpRoot_Projects\Projects_Project_Purchases_Reports_Inquiries|Processing Purchases on Projects: Related Reports] *:In the following sections, you can find details about the reports and inquiry forms you may want to review to gather information about the purchases of stock items that have been processed or are being processed in the system.

Processing Purchases on Projects: General Information In Acumatica ERP, you can purchase materials and services on projects using purchase orders and accounts payable bills so that these purchases affect the cost budget of the projects. Learning Objectives You will learn how to do the following: Purchase materials and services for a project using a purchase order Receive materials purchased for a project to a warehouse Purchase services for a project using an accounts payable bill Applicable Scenarios You create a purchase order for a project if you want to purchase materials and services so that the purchase affect the cost budget of the project. You create an accounts payable bill for the same reasons if your purchase includes only services that do not require receiving to a warehouse. Configuring of Inventory for Processing Purchases on Projects To be able to purchase the following inventory items for projects, the corresponding accounts of the items must be mapped to an account group: Stock items: The inventory account of the corresponding posting class specified in the Inventory/Accrual Account box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN206000|IN206000]) Posting Classes (IN206000) form Non-stock items that do not require receipt—that is, the Require Receipt check box is cleared on the General Settings tab ( Item Defaults section) of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form: The expense account of the item specified in the Expense Account box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items form Non-stock items that require receipt—that is, the Require Receipt check box is selected on the General Settings tab ( Item Defaults section) of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items form: The expense account of the corresponding posting class specified in the COGS/Expense Account box on the GL Accounts tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN206000|IN206000]) Posting Classes form To be able to receive purchased stock items and non-stock items that require receipt to a warehouse, on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN204000|IN204000]) Warehouses (IN204000) form, you need to create a separate location for each project task for which you are going to receive purchased inventory items to a warehouse. Processing of Purchase Orders for Projects You can purchase materials and services for projects using purchase orders of the Normal type. On the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, to associate a purchase order line with a project, you specify the project and a project task. If you do not want to associate a purchase order line with any project, you select the non-project code ( X ). You can process purchases for several projects with a single purchase order. If you select a sock item in a purchase order line, the line is assigned the Goods for IN type. When you select in a purchase order line a non-stock item that requires receipt—that is, the Require Receipt check box is selected for the non-stock item on the General Settings tab ( Item Defaults section) of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form—the line is assigned the Non-Stock type. When you select in a purchase order line a non-stock item that does not require receipt, the line is assigned the Service type. If you purchase some material from a vendor directly to a customer and do not need to receive the material to your warehouse, you can create non-stock items that do not require receipt to represent these materials in the system. When you purchase such materials with a purchase order, you do not need to create a purchase receipt for them. You create a purchase receipt for the purchase order lines of the Goods for IN and Non-Stock types to receive the inventory items to the warehouse. On the form toolbar of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, you click Actions Enter PO Receipt to create a purchase receipt. When you release the created purchase receipt on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form and the corresponding inventory receipt is released on the ([~/?ScreenId=IN301000|IN301000]) Receipts (IN301000) form, the system updates the corresponding budget lines of the project with the same project task, account group (by the inventory or expense account), and inventory item on the Cost Budget tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form. The system updates the Actual Quantity and Actual Amount of these cost budget lines with the received quantity and amount. When you create an accounts payable bill for the purchase order lines of the Service type and release the bill on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form, the system updates the budget lines of the project with the same project task, account group (by the expense account), and inventory item on the Cost Budget tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form. The system updates the Actual Quantity and Actual Amount of these cost budget lines with the billed quantity and amount. For more information on processing purchase order, see Standard Inventory Purchases: General Information. Workflow of Purchasing on Projects with Purchase Orders The following diagram illustrates the workflow of purchasing on projects using purchase orders. Processing of Account Payable Bills for Projects You can purchase services for projects using accounts payable bills. A service is a non-stock item that does not require receipt—that is, the Require Receipt check box is cleared for the non-stock item on the General Settings tab ( Item Defaults section) of the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form. On the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form, to associate a bill line with a non-stock item with a project, you specify the project and a project task. If you do not want to associate a bill line with any project, you select the non-project code ( X ). You can purchase services for several projects with a single AP bill. When you release the account payable bill with lines related to a project, the system updates the budget lines of the project with the same project task, account group (by the expense account), and inventory item on the Cost Budget tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form. The system updates the Actual Quantity and Actual Amount of these cost budget lines with the billed quantity and amount. For more information on processing accounts payable bills, see AP Bills: General Info. The following sections provide details you can use to ensure that the system is configured properly for processing purchases on projects, and to understand (and change, if needed) the settings that affect the processing workflow. ==Implementation Checklist== We recommend that before you initially process purchases on projects, you make sure the needed features have been enabled, settings have been specified, and entities have been created, as summarized in the following checklist.[anchor|#_85f5b1eb-16bc-4091-b7a6-60a8b5fe2b59] {| class="checklist" | width="100%" |- !width="50%" ! Form !width="50%" ! Tasks to Perform |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form | Make sure that the ''Project Accounting'' feature is enabled. |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_10_10_00|Projects Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=PM101000|PM101000]) form | Make sure that all necessary settings related to project accounting have been specified. For more information about configuration steps that you have to perform before you can start accounting for projects, see [HelpRoot_Projects\config_Project_Basic_GeneralInfo|Project Basic Configuration: General Information]. |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form | Make sure that the ''Inventory and Order Management'' and ''Inventory'' features are enabled. |- | | Make sure that the basic inventory and order management preferences have been configured, as described in [HelpRoot_OrderMgmt\config_InvMgmt_Basic_GeneralInfo|Order Management with Inventory Configuration: General Information]. |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_10_00|Projects] ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) form | Make sure that the project has been created, as described in [HelpRoot_Projects\Projects_Process_GeneralInfo|Project Processing: General Information]. |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\IN_20_20_00|Non-Stock Items] ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) form | Make sure that all needed labor items, non-stock items, and services have been defined. For more information about labor items, non-stock items, and services, see [HelpRoot_Projects\Non_Stock_Item_Projects_GeneralInfo|Labor Items: General Information], [HelpRoot_InvMgmt\Entity_OrderMgmt_Non_Stock_Items_GeneralInfo|Creating Non-Stock Items: General Information], and [HelpRoot_InvMgmt\Entity_Services_GeneralInfo|Creating Service Items: General Information], respectively. |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\IN_20_25_00|Stock Items] ([~/?ScreenId=IN202500|IN202500]) form | Make sure that all stock items have been defined. For more information about stock items, see [HelpRoot_InvMgmt\Stock_Items_GeneralInfo|Stock Items: General Information]. |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\IN_20_40_00|Warehouses] ([~/?ScreenId=IN204000|IN204000]) form | Make sure that a separate location is created and associated with each project task for which you need to receive inventory items to a warehouse. For details, see [HelpRoot_InvMgmt\Warehouse_Locations_GeneralInfo|Warehouse Locations and Single-Step Transfers: General Information]. |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_20_10_00|Account Groups] ([~/?ScreenId=PM201000|PM201000]) form | Make sure that all needed account groups have been configured. Also, make sure that the following accounts are mapped to the account groups:[anchor|#_8f172776-d71e-41d1-bf98-0b2cc93f1cc4] *Expense accounts of non-stock items that do not require receipts *Expense accounts of posting classes of non-stock items that require receipts *Inventory accounts of posting classes of stock items
For more information about account groups, see [HelpRoot_Projects\Account_Groups_GeneralInfo|Account Groups: General Information]. |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_30_30_00|Vendors] ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) form | Make sure that all needed vendors have been defined in the system, as described in [HelpRoot_Financials\Vendor_GeneralInfo|Vendors: General Information]. |} ==Other Settings That Affect the Workflow== You can affect the workflow of processing purchases on projects by specifying additional settings as follows:[anchor|#_50a95b7f-f671-4287-bf30-2454483b4280] *To cause the system to automatically select a project task when a particular project is selected during the creation of a purchase order, select the '''Default''' check box on the '''Tasks''' tab of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_10_00|Projects] ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) form for one of the tasks of the project. *To avoid obligatory printing of created purchase orders, clear the '''Print Orders''' check box on the '''Purchase Settings''' tab ('''Default Location Settings''' section) of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_30_30_00|Vendors] ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) form for all applicable vendors. (A user can still print any purchase order of the vendor, if needed.) *To avoid obligatory emailing of created purchase orders, clear the '''Send Orders by Email''' check box on the '''Purchase Settings''' tab ('''Default Location Settings''' section) of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_30_30_00|Vendors] form for all applicable vendors. (A user can still email any purchase order of the vendor, if needed.) *To cause the system to not copy non-stock lines of the ''Service'' type in purchase orders of the ''Normal'' type to purchase receipts and bill such lines directly from purchase orders, clear the '''Process Service Lines from Normal Purchase Orders via Purchase Receipt''' check box on the '''General Settings''' tab ('''Other''' section) of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PO_10_10_00|Purchase Orders Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) form. *To cause the system to create purchase receipts with the ''Balanced'' status, clear the '''Hold Receipts on Entry''' check box on the '''General Settings''' tab ('''Other''' section) of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PO_10_10_00|Purchase Orders Preferences] form. *To cause the system to automatically release inventory receipts created on release of purchase receipts, select the '''Release IN Documents Automatically''' check box on the '''General Settings''' tab ('''Other''' section) of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PO_10_10_00|Purchase Orders Preferences] form. *To cause an accounts payable bill to be created automatically on release of a purchase receipt by default, select the '''Create Bill on Receipt Release''' check box on the '''General Settings''' tab ('''Other''' section) of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PO_10_10_00|Purchase Orders Preferences] form. In this case, when a user creates a purchase receipt on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PO_30_20_00|Purchase Receipts] ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) form, the system automatically selects the '''Create Bill''' check box. With these settings specified, users in your company can process purchases on projects quickly and accurately with a minimum of manual actions. ==Validation of Configuration== To make sure that all configuration has been performed correctly, we recommend that you perform instructions similar to those described in [HelpRoot_Projects\Projects_Project_Purchases_Process_Activity_PO|Processing Purchases on Projects: To Purchase Materials and Services for a Project] and [HelpRoot_Projects\Projects_Project_Purchases_Process_Activity_AP_Bill|Processing Purchases on Projects: To Purchase Services for a Project].

Processing Purchases on Projects: Implementation Checklist The following sections provide details you can use to ensure that the system is configured properly for processing purchases on projects, and to understand (and change, if needed) the settings that affect the processing workflow. Implementation Checklist We recommend that before you initially process purchases on projects, you make sure the needed features have been enabled, settings have been specified, and entities have been created, as summarized in the following checklist. Form Tasks to Perform ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form Make sure that the Project Accounting feature is enabled. ([~/?ScreenId=PM101000|PM101000]) Projects Preferences (PM101000) form Make sure that all necessary settings related to project accounting have been specified. For more information about configuration steps that you have to perform before you can start accounting for projects, see Project Basic Configuration: General Information. ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form Make sure that the Inventory and Order Management and Inventory features are enabled. To cause the system to create purchase receipts with the Balanced status, clear the Hold Receipts on Entry check box on the General Settings tab ( Other section) of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences form. To cause the system to automatically release inventory receipts created on release of purchase receipts, select the Release IN Documents Automatically check box on the General Settings tab ( Other section) of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences form. To cause an accounts payable bill to be created automatically on release of a purchase receipt by default, select the Create Bill on Receipt Release check box on the General Settings tab ( Other section) of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO101000|PO101000]) Purchase Orders Preferences form. Processing Purchases on Projects: To Purchase Materials and Services for a Project The following activity will walk you through the process of purchasing materials and services for a project from a subcontractor with purchase orders. The following activity is based on the U100 dataset. If you are using another dataset, or if any system settings have been changed in U100 , these changes can affect the workflow of the activity and the results of the processing. To avoid any issues, restore the U100 dataset to its initial state. Story Suppose that the HM's Bakery and Cafe customer has ordered two juicers, along with the four hours of the installation service from the SweetLife Fruits & Jams company. The SweetLife company contracted the Squeezo Inc. vendor to provide the juicers and perform the installation. SweetLife's project manager has created the project. Acting as SweetLife's project accountant, you need to purchase the materials and services from the vendor. When the vendor delivers the juicers to company's warehouse, you will process a purchase receipt for the juicers. When the vendor provides the installation service, you will process an account payable bill from the vendor for the delivered juicers and provided service. Configuration Overview For the purposes of this activity, the following features have been enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form: Project Accounting , which provides support for the project accounting functionality Inventory and Order Management , which provides the purchase order functionality On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form, the HMBAKERY2 project has been created and the INSTALL project task has been created for the project. This task is the default project task. On the ([~/?ScreenId=IN204000|IN204000]) Warehouses (IN204000) form, the EQUIPHOUSE warehouse has been created and the HMBAKERY2 location has been created for the INSTALL task of the HMBAKERY2 project. On the ([~/?ScreenId=IN206000|IN206000]) Posting Classes (IN206000) form, the PMSTOCK posting class has been created. On the GL Accounts tab, the 12110 - Project Inventory account has been selected in the Inventory/Accrual Account box. On the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202500|IN202500]) Stock Items (IN202500) form, the JUICER10C stock item of the Service type has been configured. On the General Settings tab ( Item Defaults section), the PMSTOCK posting class has been selected in the Posting Class box. On the Price/Cost Info tab ( Cost Statistic section), the Last Cost of the item has been set to 1500.00 . On the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form, the INSTALL non-stock item of the Service type has been configured. On the General Settings tab ( Item Defaults section), the Require Receipt check box has been cleared. On the Price/Cost Information tab ( Standard Cost section), the Current Cost of the item has been set to 80.00 . On the GL Accounts tab, the 54200 - Project Subcontract Expense account has been selected in the Expense Account box. On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM201000|PM201000]) Account Groups (PM201000) form, the SUBCON and MATERIAL account groups have been created. The 54200 - Project Subcontract Expense account has been mapped to the SUBCON account group and the 12110 - Project Inventory account has been mapped to the MATERIAL account group. On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP303000|AP303000]) Vendors (AP303000) form, the SQUEEZO vendor has been created. Process Overview In this activity, you will create a purchase order for the project specifying the project and project task on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form. On the same form, you will then create a purchase receipt and release it on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form. You will bill the purchase order on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) and then release the bill on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form. You will also review the project balances on the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form. System Preparation To sign in to the system and prepare to perform the instructions of the activity, do the following: Launch the Acumatica ERP website, and sign in to a company with the U100 dataset preloaded as Pam Brawner by using the brawner username and the 123 password. In the info area, in the upper-right corner of the top pane of the Acumatica ERP screen, make sure that the business date in your system is set to 1/30/2020. If a different date is displayed, click the Business Date menu button, and select 1/30/2020 on the calendar. For simplicity, in this activity, you will create and process all documents in the system during this business date. Step 1: Creating a Purchase Order for the Project To create a purchase order for the project, do the following: On the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, create a purchase order, and specify the following settings in the Summary area: Vendor : SQUEEZO Description : Purchase for HM's Bakery & Cafe On the Document Details tab, add three purchase order lines, and specify the settings shown in the following table in the lines you add. Inventory ID Order Qty. Project JUICER10C 2.00 HMBAKERY2 INSTALL 4.00 HMBAKERY2 The system automatically selects the INSTALL project task for each line when you select the HMBAKERY2 project because this task is the default project task of the project. For the line with the JUICER10C stock item, the system automatically selects the EQUIPHOUSE warehouse. In the Summary area, notice that the Order Total values, which is the sum of the Ext. Cost of two lines ( 3000.00 and 320.00 ), is 3320.00 . In the Summary area, clear the Hold check box. Save the purchase order, which now has the Open status. Step 2: Receiving the Purchased Materials to a Warehouse To create a purchase receipt for the purchased materials, do the following: While remaining on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form, on the form toolbar, click Actions Enter PO Receipt . The system creates a purchase receipt for two JUICER10C items and opens it on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) Purchase Receipts (PO302000) form. Notice that the purchase receipt has the Balanced status. On the form toolbar cluck Release to release the purchase receipt. The system creates an inventory receipt based on the purchase receipt and assigns the Released status to the purchase receipt. On the Other Information tab, click the link in the IN Ref. Nbr. box to open the inventory receipt that was created. On the ([~/?ScreenId=IN301000|IN301000]) Receipts (IN301000) form, which the system opens in a pop-up window, notice that the inventory receipt was automatically released and had been assigned the Released status. On the Financial Details tab, click the link in the Batch Nbr. box to review the batch of general ledger transactions that the system created on release of the inventory receipt. On the ([~/?ScreenId=GL301000|GL301000]) Journal Transactions (GL301000) form, which opens in a pop-up window, review created general ledger transactions. Notice that the system debited the 21110 - Project Inventory account for 3000.00 . This GL transaction has the project and project task specified. Close the pop-up windows with the ([~/?ScreenId=GL301000|GL301000]) Journal Transactions and ([~/?ScreenId=IN301000|IN301000]) Receipts forms. On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form, open the HMBAKERY2 project. On the Cost Budget tab, review the actual values of the cost budget. Notice that the Actual Quantity and Actual Amount of the line with the JUICER10C item equal to 2 and 3000.00 , respectively. Also notice that the actual values of the line with the INSTALL item equal to zero. To review the project transaction that correspond to the cost budget line with the JUICER10C item, do the following: In the table, click the cost budget line. On the table toolbar, click View Transactions . On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM401000|PM401000]) Project Transaction Details (PM401000) form, which the system opens in a pop-up window, review the transaction that the system created on release of the batch of GL transactions that you have reviewed. You can find the reference number of the GL batch in the GL Batch column. Close the pop-up window with the form. Step 3: Creating a Bill for the Purchase Order To bill the purchase order, do the following: On the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders ( PO301000) form, open the purchase order you created in Step 2. On the form toolbar, click Actions Enter AP Bill to create a bill for the purchase order. The system creates an accounts payable bill and opens the bill on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form. On the Document Details tab, notice that the system has added only one line with the INSTALL item. In the Summary area, notice the bill balance is 320.00 . On the table toolbar of the Document Details tab, click Add PO Receipt to add the juicers to the bill. In the Add PO Receipt dialog box, which the system has opened in a pop-up window, select the purchase receipt with the total quantity equals to 2 and the total cost equals to 3000.00 by selecting the check box in the unlabeled column, and click Add & Close . The system closes the dialog box and adds the lines of the selected purchase receipt to the bill. In the Summary area, notice that the bill balance becomes 3320.00 . In the Summary area, clear the Hold check box, and on the form toolbar, click Release to release the bill. On the Financial Details tab, click the link in the Batch Nbr. box to review the batch of general ledger transactions that the system created on release of the bill. On the ([~/?ScreenId=GL301000|GL301000]) Journal Transactions (GL301000) form, which opens in a pop-up window, review created general ledger transactions. Notice that the system debited the 54200 - Project Subcontract Expense account for 320.00 . This GL transaction has the project and project task specified. Close the pop-up windows with the ([~/?ScreenId=GL301000|GL301000]) Journal Transactions form. On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form, open the HMBAKERY2 project. On the Cost Budget tab, review the actual values of the cost budget. Notice that the Actual Quantity and Actual Amount of the line with the INSTALL item equal to 4 and 320.00 , respectively. Also notice that the actual expenses of the project in the Summary area equals to 3320.00 .

On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form, the HMBAKERY14 project has been created and the INSTALL project task has been created for the project. This task is the default project task. On the ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) Non-Stock Items (IN202000) form, the INSTALL non-stock item of the Service type has been configured. On the Price/Cost Information tab ( Standard Cost section), the Current Cost of the item has been set to 80.00 . On the GL Accounts tab, the 54200 - Project Subcontract Expense account has been selected in the Expense Account box. On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM201000|PM201000]) Account Groups (PM201000) form, the SUBCON account group has been created and the 54200 - Project Subcontract Expense account has been mapped to the account group. In the info area, in the upper-right corner of the top pane of the Acumatica ERP screen, make sure that the business date in your system is set to 1/30/2020. Step 1: Creating a Bill for the Project To create an accounts payable bill for the project, do the following: On the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form, create a bill, and select the SQUEEZO vendor in the Summary area. On the Document Details tab, click Add Row on the table toolbar, and add a row with the following settings: On the form, create a bill with the following settings: Inventory ID : INSTALL Quantity : 6.00 Project : HMBAKERY14 Notice that the system has selected 54200 - Project Subcontract Expense as the Account of the bill line, because this is the expense account of the selected item. The following sections explain how to mass-process purchase orders and related documents, and how the system generates, changes, or works with documents as a result of the mass processing. {br}{TOC} ==Mass-Releasing Purchase Receipts== You can release multiple purchase receipts at the same time by using the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PO_50_10_00|Release Purchase Receipts] ([~/?ScreenId=PO501000|PO501000]) form. On this form, you select the unlabeled check boxes in the rows to be processed, and click '''Process''' on the form toolbar to release the selected documents. ==Printing and Emailing Multiple Purchase Orders== If needed, you can print or email multiple purchase orders at the same time by using the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PO_50_30_00|Print/Email Purchase Orders] ([~/?ScreenId=PO503000|PO503000]) form. To do this for multiple purchase orders simultaneously, you select the ''Print Purchase Order'' or ''Email Purchase Order'' action, select the unlabeled check boxes for the rows to be processed, and click '''Process''' on the form toolbar to process the selected documents. ==Consolidating Purchase Orders or Lines into a Single Purchase Receipt== Instead of preparing an individual purchase receipt for each purchase order, you can add multiple purchase orders of one vendor to a single purchase receipt; you can also add individual lines of one purchase order or multiple purchase orders. To do this, you create a new purchase receipt of the ''Receipt'' type manually on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PO_30_20_00|Purchase Receipts] ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) form; you then click '''Add PO''' on the table toolbar of the '''Document Details''' tab and add the lines of multiple purchase orders with the same vendor to the purchase receipt. If you click '''Add PO Line''' on the table toolbar, you can add purchase receipt lines. ==Consolidating Purchase Receipts or Lines into a Single Bill== Instead of preparing an individual accounts payable bill for each purchase receipt, you can add multiple purchase receipts of one vendor to a single bill; you can also add individual lines of one purchase receipt or multiple purchase receipts. To do this, you create a new accounts payable bill manually on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_30_10_00|Bills and Adjustments] ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) form and make sure that the ''Tax Settings'' option is selected in the '''Tax Calculation Mode''' box on the '''Financial Details''' tab. You then click '''Add PO Receipt''' on the table toolbar of the '''Document Details''' tab and add the lines of multiple purchase receipts with the same vendor to the bill. If you click '''Add PO Receipt Line''' on the table toolbar, you can add purchase receipt lines.

Processing Purchases on Projects: Mass-Processing of Documents The following sections explain how to mass-process purchase orders and related documents, and how the system generates, changes, or works with documents as a result of the mass processing. To do this for multiple purchase orders simultaneously, you select the Print Purchase Order or Email Purchase Order action, select the unlabeled check boxes for the rows to be processed, and click Process on the form toolbar to process the selected documents. If you click Add PO Line on the table toolbar, you can add purchase receipt lines. Consolidating Purchase Receipts or Lines into a Single Bill Instead of preparing an individual accounts payable bill for each purchase receipt, you can add multiple purchase receipts of one vendor to a single bill; you can also add individual lines of one purchase receipt or multiple purchase receipts. To do this, you create a new accounts payable bill manually on the ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) Bills and Adjustments (AP301000) form and make sure that the Tax Settings option is selected in the Tax Calculation Mode box on the Financial Details tab. You then click Add PO Receipt on the table toolbar of the Document Details tab and add the lines of multiple purchase receipts with the same vendor to the bill. If you click Add PO Receipt Line on the table toolbar, you can add purchase receipt lines.

The left table on this tab lists all the purchase receipts that have been prepared for the order, and the table footer shows the summary information for all listed documents. To review the details of a listed purchase receipt, you click its reference number in the '''Receipt Nbr.''' column; the system opens the purchase receipt for review on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PO_30_20_00|Purchase Receipts] ([~/?ScreenId=PO302000|PO302000]) form. ==Finding the Bills Related to a Purchase Order== If you need to find an accounts payable bill linked to a particular purchase order, you can open the purchase order on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PO_30_10_00|Purchase Orders] ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) form and review the '''PO History''' tab. The right table on this tab lists all the accounts payable documents that have been prepared for the order, and the table footer shows the summary information for all listed documents. To review the details of a listed bill, you click its reference number in the '''Reference Nbr.''' column; the system opens the accounts payable bill for review on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\AP_30_10_00|Bills and Adjustments] ([~/?ScreenId=AP301000|AP301000]) form. ==Reviewing the Unbilled Quantities of a Purchase Order== To check whether a purchase order has quantities of items and amounts that have not yet been billed, you can review the '''Unbilled Quantity''' and '''Unbilled Amount''' boxes on the '''Other Information''' tab of the [HelpRoot_FormReference\PO_30_10_00|Purchase Orders] ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) form. ==Printing a Purchase Order== To prepare a printable version of the purchase order that is being processed, you use the [HelpRoot_ReportReference\PO_64_10_00|Purchase Order] ([~/?ScreenId=PO641000|PO641000]) report. The system opens the printable version of the document on the [HelpRoot_ReportReference\PO_64_10_00|Purchase Order] report; then you can review the order and print it by clicking '''Print''' on the report toolbar.

Processing Commitments: General Information Acumatica ERP supports the tracking of purchase orders for each project as project cost commitments, which gives you the ability to control purchases made for projects. When the commitments are created, the system uses them to populate the cost budget for the corresponding project, project task, inventory item, and account group. Learning Objectives In this chapter, you will learn how to do the following: Create commitments by processing a purchase order Review the created commitments and the way they affect the project Bill the purchase order and review how the commitments have been affected Review the committed and actual values of the project budget Applicable Scenarios If you want to distinguish purchases within the cost budget of a project, you use commitments, which you create by processing purchase orders with detail lines related to the project. The commitments update the cost budget of a project with purchased services and materials. Tracking of Committed Costs for Projects If the Internal Cost Commitment Tracking check box is selected on the General Settings tab ( General Settings section) of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM101000|PM101000]) Projects Preferences (PM101000) form, the system exposes commitments on the ([~/?ScreenId=PM306000|PM306000]) Commitments (PM306000) form, as well as the following committed values of the project budget on the Cost Budget tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects (PM301000) form: Original Committed Quantity Original Committed Amount Revised Committed Quantity Revised Committed Amount Committed Open Quantity Committed Open Amount Committed Received Quantity Committed Invoiced Quantity Committed Invoiced Amount The system creates a commitment for a purchase order line in the amount of the Ext. Cost of the line and updates the committed values of the corresponding budget line of a project on the Cost Budget tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects form if all of the following conditions are met on the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form: The type of the purchase order is Normal or Drop-Ship . The status of the purchase order is Pending Printing , Pending Email , or Open . The purchase order line specifies the project (and the applicable project task). These commitments have the Internal type because they originate from documents created in the system, unlike commitments of the External type that can be imported into Acumatica ERP. On the Cost Budget tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) Projects form, for each budget line, the system displays the total values of all the commitments that are associated with the same project, project task, account group, and inventory item. The initial commitment amount is displayed in the Original Committed Amount column and the Revised Committed Amount column. The Committed Open Amount of a new commitment is equal to the Revised Committed Amount . When you release an accounts payable bill with the purchase order lines of the Service type, the Committed Invoiced Quantity and Committed Invoiced Amount of the corresponding commitments are updated with the Quantity and Ext. Cost values of the bill lines, respectively. The Committed Invoiced Quantity and Committed Invoiced Amount are subtracted from the Committed Open Quantity and Committed Open Amount and added to the Actual Quantity and Actual Amount , respectively. When an inventory receipt that corresponds to the purchase receipt with the purchase order lines of the Goods for IN or Non-Stock type is released, the Committed Received Quantity of the corresponding commitments is updated with the received quantity. The received quantity and the amount of the Ext. Cost of the related purchase order lines that correspond to the received quantity are subtracted from the Committed Open Quantity and Committed Open Amount and added to the Actual Quantity and Actual Amount , respectively. When the purchase order lines of the Goods for IN or Non-Stock type are billed, the Committed Invoiced Quantity and Committed Invoiced Amount of the corresponding commitments are updated with the Quantity and Ext. Cost values of the bill lines, respectively. After a purchase order is received and billed fully, the Committed Open Quantity and Committed Open Amount of the corresponding commitment lines becomes zero. If a purchase order has been canceled, the incomplete amounts are subtracted from the Committed Open Amount . For more information about processing purchase orders for projects, see Processing Purchases on Projects: General Information. Workflow of Commitments The following diagram illustrates the workflow of processing a commitment and the ways the commitment affects the project budget. Updating of Documents from Which Commitments Originate You can update a purchase order from which a commitments originates. When you update the Ext. Cost of the purchase order line that refers to the project on the Document Details tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=PO301000|PO301000]) Purchase Orders (PO301000) form and save the purchase order with the Pending Printing , Pending Email , or Open status, the system updates the Original Committed Amount and the Revised Committed Amount of the corresponding commitment. Recreating of Commitments Although you usually do not need to recreate commitments, in rare cases, the committed values of the project budget may not match the underlying commitments. In such a case, you need to recreate commitments for a project. On the ([~/?ScreenId=PM504000|PM504000]) Validate Project Balances (PM504000) form, you select the Rebuild Commitments check box in the Summary area, select the check box in the unlabeled column in the table for the project, and click Validate on the form toolbar.

For more information about configuration steps that you have to perform before you can start accounting for projects, see [HelpRoot_Projects\config_Project_Basic_GeneralInfo|Project Basic Configuration: General Information].{br}
Also, make sure that the '''Internal Cost Commitment Tracking''' check box is selected on the '''General Settings''' tab ('''General Settings''' section). |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form | Make sure that the ''Inventory and Order Management'' and ''Inventory'' features are enabled. |- | | Make sure that the basic inventory and order management preferences have been configured, as described in [HelpRoot_OrderMgmt\config_InvMgmt_Basic_GeneralInfo|Order Management with Inventory Configuration: General Information]. |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_30_10_00|Projects] ([~/?ScreenId=PM301000|PM301000]) form | Make sure that the project has been created, as described in [HelpRoot_Projects\Projects_Process_GeneralInfo|Project Processing: General Information]. |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\IN_20_20_00|Non-Stock Items] ([~/?ScreenId=IN202000|IN202000]) form | Make sure that all needed labor items, non-stock items, and services have been defined. For details, see [HelpRoot_InvMgmt\Warehouse_Locations_GeneralInfo|Warehouse Locations and Single-Step Transfers: General Information]. |- | [HelpRoot_FormReference\PM_20_10_00|Account Groups] ([~/?ScreenId=PM201000|PM201000]) form | Make sure that all needed account groups have been configured.
